content.title: Intro
content.content:
2018
Preceded by
2018
2019
Year
2020
Followed by
2020

Tolkien-related events that took place in 2019.

content.title: January
content.content:
3 - Birthday Toast.
25 - Morgan Library's exhibition "Tolkien: Maker of Middle-earth" opens.
? - Amon Hen 275 is published.

content.title: March
content.content:
22 - Jared Lobdell dies.
25 - Tolkien Reading Day.
25 - Tolkien the Pagan? is published.
? - Amon Hen 276 is published.

content.title: April
content.content: 9 - Middle-Earth: Journeys in Myth and Legend is published.

content.title: May
content.content:
3 - The biographical film, Tolkien, is released in the United Kingdom.
10 - The biographical film, Tolkien, is released in the United States.
12 - Morgan Library's exhibition "Tolkien: Maker of Middle-earth" closes.
26 - British actor Stephen Thorne dies.
? - Amon Hen 277 is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
7 - Tolkien and the Classics is published.
7-11 - The Tolkien Society's Tolkien 2019 event in Birmingham, UK.

content.title: September
content.content:
5 - Tolkien Calendar 2020 is published.
13 - 15 - Oxonmoot 2019 at St Antony's College.
23 - "Something Has Gone Crack" is published.
26 - Tolkien's Lost Chaucer is published.
? - Amon Hen 279 is published.

content.title: October
content.content:
7 - Music in Tolkien's Work and Beyond is published.
22 - la BnF's exhibition "Tolkien, voyage en Terre du Milieu" opens.

content.title: November
content.content:
5 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Minas Morgul is released online.
14 - The Hobbit Sketchbook is published.
? - Amon Hen 280 is published.

content.title: Unknown
content.content:
? - Christopher Tolkien confirmed to John Garth that he did intend to edit The Bovadium Fragments for publication.[1]
Years
2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ John Garth, "Here's the cover of Tolkien's satire on Oxford and the motor car, THE BOVADIUM FRAGMENTS, out on 9 October." dated 24 May 2025, Facebook.com (accessed 30 May 2025)
